title: Hans Anton Aalien
text:
Hans Anton Aalien (born 21 September 1958) is a <a href="Blindness">blind</a> <a href="skier">skier</a> from <a href="Eggedal">Eggedal</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. He won a <a href="gold%20medal">gold medal</a> in the <a href="disabled%20skiing%20at%20the%201988%20Winter%20Olympics">disabled skiing at the 1988 Winter Olympics</a> event in <a href="Calgary">Calgary</a>, <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a>, Canada with a time of 18 minutes, 52.2 seconds. He participated in <a href="track%20and%20field%20athletics">track and field athletics</a> at four consecutive <a href="Summer%20Paralympics">Summer Paralympics</a>, from 1976 to 1988, and also competed in swimming in 1976 and 1984. He won one bronze medal in athletics and a silver and a bronze in swimming. At the <a href="Winter%20Paralympics">Winter Paralympics</a>, he competed in <a href="cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross-country skiing</a> in 1980, 1984, and 1988, and medaled in every event he participated in. He won a total of seven golds, one silver, and one bronze winter Paralympic medal.
He was born in <a href="Elverum%2C%20Norway">Elverum, Norway</a>.
